parts.question_text: Express \(g(x)\) in the form \(2(x+r)^2 + s\), where \(r\) and \(s\) are constants to be found.
parts.solution_text:
We complete the square for the expression inside the brackets:
\(g(x) = 2x^2 + 12x + 11\)
\(g(x) = 2(x^2 + 6x) + 11\)
\(g(x) = 2[(x+3)^2 - 9] + 11\)
\(g(x) = 2(x+3)^2 - 18 + 11\)
\(g(x) = 2(x+3)^2 - 7\)
Therefore, \(r = 3\) and \(s = -7\).
